meanings.definition: To support or confirm the validity or accuracy of something.
meanings.sent1: She was vouching for the quality of the product.
meanings.sent2: He is vouching for his friend's honesty.
meanings.sent3: The cat was vouching for the mouse's innocence in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The bright sun vouching for the arrival of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The loud applause vouching for the success of the performance.

meanings.definition: To give personal assurance or guarantee.
meanings.sent1: I am vouching that the package will arrive on time.
meanings.sent2: She vouched for his character without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The dog vouched for his loyalty by wagging his tail enthusiastically.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse vouching for safe passage through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The smile on her face vouching for her happiness.

meanings.definition: To attest to the truth or accuracy of something.
meanings.sent1: The witness was vouching for what he saw at the scene.
meanings.sent2: He vouched for the authenticity of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The parrot vouching for the correctness of the answer in a comical way.
meanings.sent4: The old tree vouching for the passing of time with its rings.
meanings.sent5: The thunder vouching for the approaching storm.
